elements.title: Stenka Razin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first Russian feature film, Stenka Razin (poster pictured), depicts the historical Cossack leader throwing a princess into the Volga?

elements.title: John Schrank (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that would-be assassin John Schrank was foiled by a 50-page speech and a spectacles case?

elements.title: Balconcillo mutiny (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Balconcillo mutiny is considered to be the first coup d'état in the history of Peru?

elements.title: Marie Vuillemin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Marie Vuillemin was acquitted in the trial of the Bonnot Gang, as the prosecution defined her according to her gender rather than her role in the gang?

elements.title: Leilani Tominiko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New Zealand wrestler Leilani Tominiko (aka. Candy Lee) has a signature move called the Candy Crush?

elements.title: Seattle metropolitan area (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Seattle metropolitan area includes two major volcanoes, Mount Rainier and Glacier Peak?

elements.title: Mori Calliope (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for at least 90 minutes, Mori Calliope livestreamed herself begging video game developer Atlus to allow her to stream their game Persona 3?

elements.title: a high school in Taiwan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the principal of a high school in Taiwan resigned after students held a Nazi-themed parade, complete with mock uniforms and a cardboard tank?
